Title: N/A

reviewText: First off, be prepared for a MAJOR SPOILER here:Ugh, what a miserable piece of trash!  This has to be one of the worst 70s liberated thinking "love" stories I have ever seen since the horrible film adaptation of Judy Blume's Forever starring Stephanie Zimbalist and Dean Butler from Little House on the Prairie.  This one has William Katt, the bumbling underwear donning idiot from Greatest American Hero, and Susan Dey, Laurie from the Partridge Family, playing college sweethearts (more like sweet hard-ons) with zero chemistry.  All they do is bop whenever and wherever they can like a pair of exuberant rabbits.  The little talk about intimate gratification was so very unoriginal, because most everyone talks about that stuff in private, and I started laughing.  She draws the line when he wants to do it in a playhouse her suicidal father had built for her, and the fact that he wants to do it there creeps me out too!  Wisely, she dumps him after that little scene to unwisely hook back up with an older unmarried man.  Then she bounces right back to him like an out-of-control tennis ball and he decides he doesn't love her after all.  You call this a great, heartbreaking love story?  I guess some of these actors just wanted to break out of their typecast cutey pie roles, but it's painfully obvious they were trying too hard.  Also, Beverly D'Angelo's character was such an idiotic nympho, I was embarrassed for her.  She must have really needed a paycheck badly to be in this thing.  A boring waste of 90 minutes, I'd rather watch ants walk across a picnic spread.
summary: I Guess I'm a Lone Voice in the Wilderness Here.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I remember seeing this movie in the 70's, now that I stumbled upon this movie through amazon, it brought back all the sad memories from the movie as well as my own during that time period, young, carefree, being in love, and had to let the first love of my life go.I wish there are DVDs for me to buy. I may buy it and burn it to DVD, it worths the effort.Too bad this movie faded into oblivion, I must give this 5 stars while the other movies of the same gene, Endless Love and Love Story that have better music scores will hold a 2 stars in comparison.
summary: sad movie but...it is a hidden treasure

reviewText: Ive been waiting for this movie (VHS) for a long time. I cant wait to get it, I ordered it the quickest way possible. What a great sweet love story! William Katt loves susan dey, but she loves an older married man and goes back and forth to Katt, untill one day he's had enough.I wont tell you the ending, in case you wanna see it yourself and I hope you do. This movie is chockful of beautiful sweet love songs, Cat Stevens, Paul williams and a lot from the day (It was in the 70's!I always had great service while ordering with amazon and I'll keep on doing service with them!

reviewText: Why isn't this sweet, sad tale of first love available on dvd or bluray? It's an average story made great by it's stars. I still have the vhs tape I bought years ago. I would love to see this film get a dvd or bluray treatment.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Although the plot of this "First Love" story is fairly routine and forseeable (boy meets girl; boy gets girl; boy loses girl), the stars make it more than worthwhile.I'm not sure how much of the pivotal scene is shot using a body-double for Susan Dey (not much, I think), but it's actually irrelevant. When Ms. Dey divests herself of her dress for the first time for Katt, it's a revelation!! (No pun intended). Her pure eroticism is utterly incredible for those only familiar with her work in Partridge Family or LA Law.The film runs towards it's predictable denouement, but the whole package is well shot, well acted and incredibly well directed. If you can find it, buy it! It's worth your time.
Title: N/A
